comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Emilie was a baby on board of the steamer Appam, L. M Riley was her mother, see Tensas gazette., April 14, 1916, Image 3, with photo. The Appam was captured by the German cruiser Möwe on January 15, 1916 (according to de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Appam, in German, see also www.leagle.com/decision/1917367243US124_1349)

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The Ogden standard. (Ogden City, Utah), 01 Feb. 1916. page 1 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn85058396/1916-02-01/ed-... describes the Appam incident. According to the article above, Francis Charles Fuller, "who was appointed Chief Commissioner of Askanti in 1905" and is in neighboring picture was also supposed to be aboard.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: The same article mentions Norman R. Hamilton, Collector of the Port at Norfolk, depicted in a photo nearby see comment there
